intro: Achyrocline trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
